elements.title: Shannon Lucid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when astronaut Shannon Lucid (pictured) returned to Earth after six months in orbit, she was presented with a box of M&M's?

elements.title: Regensburg Botanical Society (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Regensburg Botanical Society, founded on 14 May 1790, is the world's oldest extant botanical society?

elements.title: Madison station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that decades after its closure, the station house of the Chicago "L"'s Madison station would house a hot dog stand?

elements.title: Romina Pérez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before entering politics, Romina Pérez worked at the Center for Legal Studies and Social Research, which "became a 'nursery' for intellectual and political cadres of the Movement for Socialism"?

elements.title: battle of Pitgaveny (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite his defeat at the battle of Pitgaveny, both of Duncan's sons would later rule Scotland?

elements.title: Kline's Mill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kline's Mill is a rare surviving example of an Oliver Evans milling system from 1794?

elements.title: Richard Thomas Glyn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the hoof of Richard Thomas Glyn's horse is used as an ashtray by officers of the Royal Regiment of Wales?

elements.title: Iqbi-damiq (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Mesopotamian goddess Iqbi-damiq had an illness named after her?
